sentences.en: A cause of action has accrued when the right to sue has become vested.
sentences.cn: 起诉的理由在控告权被赋予后随之存在.

sentences.en: A vested interest cannot be asserted against it because of conditions once obtaining.
sentences.cn: 因为一旦条件具备,某种既得利益就不能与之抗衡.

sentences.en: All authority was vested in the woman, who discharged every kind of public duty.
sentences.cn: 女性被赋予了所有权力，履行所有公共职责。

sentences.en: All power is vested in, and consequently derived from, the people.
sentences.cn: 所有的权力都属于人民, 因此也来自人民.

sentences.en: But drug companies have a vested interest in disease - mongering.
sentences.cn: 但制药公司已经从制造疾病中获得了既得利益.

sentences.en: Cabinet Ministers are selfishly pursuing their own vested interests.
sentences.cn: 内阁大臣们正在自私地追逐他们自己的既得利益。

sentences.en: He has a vested interest in Mona leaving the firm.
sentences.cn: 莫娜离开公司对他有利﹙他可能获得莫娜的职位﹚.

sentences.en: He has vested this committee with certain power.
sentences.cn: 他已授予这个委员会某种特定的权力.

sentences.en: In the 1790s Tom Paine taught plebeian radicals that mankind would live in harmony were it not for the vested interest which princes, diplomats and soldiers had in promoting wars to enrich themselves.
sentences.cn: 汤姆·潘恩在18世纪90年代教育平民激进分子时论述到，如果不是为了实现王公、外交官和士兵借发起战争而使自己富有的潜在利益，人类本会生活在和谐之中。

sentences.en: Shareholders have a vested right to 10% per annum.
sentences.cn: 股东享有每年10%分红的既定权利。

sentences.en: The management of the foundation is vested in a board of trustees.
sentences.cn: 基金会的管理交由理事会负责.

sentences.en: The power vested in the Church.
There's an extraordinary amount of power vested in us.
sentences.cn: 我们被授予了巨大的权力。

sentences.en: Upon the death of the father, the property vested upon his son.

words.tran_cn: （作礼拜时教士的）法衣；官服；祭坛布；礼服；衣服
既定的；穿着衣服（尤指祭服）的；（美）带背心的（指西服套装）

phrases.tran_cn: n. 特权阶级；既得权利

trans.tran_en: vested rights, powers, property etc belong to you and cannot be removed
